column3: You cannot fix typos in subtrees, so please remove all changes to them. Feel free to send the changes upstream.
Agree with @jarolrod here. These seem to be okay (apart from "contruct"). Don't make changes just for the sake of making changes, please.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #21992 (Feefilter cleanups by amadeuszpawlik)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review t
Thank you for your contribution. However, this patch seems controversial, so I am going to close for now.
https://www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/useable\n\nAlso, if you want to modify libraries, you will have to do it upstream
Not sure why you've dropped this and changed usages to `usable`, so you can revert that as well.
Most of the spelling in the codebase uses `usable` not `useable`.
is that really a typo? invokable seems to exist: https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/invokable (and that site lists invocable as an alternative spelling)
`invocable` is in the codebase twice and `invokable` once.  Should I change them all to `invokable` ?
